column4: Is there anyway to tell what parts of a jaunty upgrade may not be correct?  Since the upgrade, which didn't seem to finish completely, my system is messed up in a couple of key ways, like printing.
how did it not finish correctly?
Screen was nothing but closely spaced vertical lines.  Had to reboot.  Trying to rerun upgrade produces nothing new.
sudo apt-get install -f   ?
result is a couple of messages about some a few unneeded packages, but that's all.
no, those packages are needed
apt-get install -f  reports: The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer required:  foomatic-db-gutenprint ijsgutenprint mozilla-thunderbird liblrdf0
oh, can you install pastebinit?
installed pastebinit, what do I do with that?
try this: sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop^ | pastebinit
Actually, I'm a kubuntu user, with apt-get install kubuntu-desktop provide the same info?
o, yeah
http://pastebin.com/f19c65b79
is this an upgrade?
upgrade from intrepid to jaunty via internet.
yeah, pastebinit /etc/apt/sources.list
gnomefreak:  http://pastebin.com/f30173c20
well, its hard to say.  Those repos are not stable
Don't think anything in there would have broken things like printing and thunderbird.....
you also have scrollkeeper installed, which was an upgrade issue.  I don't know how to remove obsolete packages from the CLI, but using synaptic, its pretty easy
Okay - I'll check the scrollkeeper issue and remove it if I think it's problematic.
